```{r}
#| label: setup
#| message: FALSE

library(tidyverse)
library(primer.data)
library(gtsummary)
library(brms)
library(tidybayes)
```


```{r}
#| label: EDA

governors |>
  select(state, election_age, death_age) |> 
  filter(state == "Massachusetts") |>
  ggplot(aes(x = death_age)) +
  geom_density()
```


```{r}
#| label: model
#| cache: TRUE
clean <- governors |>
  select(state, election_age, death_age) |> 
  filter(state == "Massachusetts")

fit_gov <- brm(data = clean,
               formula = death_age ~ 1,
               family = gaussian(),
               silent = 2,
               refresh = 0)

```


```{r}
fit_gov
```


Preceptor Table: One row for each governor. One column for lived_after (outcome variable) and some covariates: state, election_age, party. 

Stability: People live longer now.

Representiveness: Massachusetts doesn't represent just Newton.
